title: Lesson 3
paragraph: This lesson explores cognition and insight, emphasizing the abilities to perceive, understand, and judge effectively.

words.meaning: the ability to judge well and understand subtle distinctions
words.example: Her discernment helped her identify trustworthy sources of information.
The detective’s perspicacity allowed him to solve the case quickly.

words.meaning: the ability to make good judgments and quick decisions
words.example: Her business acumen led to rapid company growth.
His astuteness in negotiations secured a favorable deal.
The elder's sagacity guided the council through difficult decisions.
The professor's lucidity made complex theories easy to understand.

words.meaning: the ability to understand deeply and perceive the true nature of something
words.example: Her penetration into human motives was impressive.

words.meaning: the quality of being based on reason and logic
words.example: Rationality is essential for making sound decisions.

words.meaning: the exercise of the intellect or reasoning
words.example: Philosophers devote their lives to deep intellection.
Her judiciousness in financial matters prevented losses.
